publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-290 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling—That the Parliament pledges its support for the moratorium on commercial whaling agreed by the International Whaling Commission meeting in Berlin; is deeply concerned that Iceland has resumed whaling and proposes to slaughter 500 sei, fin and minke whales over the next two years; deplores Iceland's killing of minke whales in 2003; notes the growing importance of whale watching and eco-tourism to the future of both the Scottish and Icelandic tourist industry, and calls on the Scottish Executive to highlight these concerns to the Her Majesty's Government and add its opposition to commercial whaling to that of the Her Majesty's Government and the wider international community. Supported by: Trish Godman*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Richard Baker*, Bristow Muldoon*, Sarah Boyack*, Bill Butler*, Michael Matheson*, Christine May*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Margaret Jamieson*, Marlyn Glen*, Nora Radcliffe*, Shiona Baird*, Eleanor Scott*, Maureen Macmillan*

S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Phil Gallie*, Elaine Smith*, Chris Ballance*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Cathie Craigie*, Dr Jean Turner*, Scott Barrie*, Mike Watson*, Mark Ballard*, Ms Sandra White*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*, Patrick Harvie*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Jackie Baillie*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Mike Pringle*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S2M-290 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling—That the Parliament pledges its support for the moratorium on commercial whaling agreed by the International Whaling Commission meeting in Berlin; is deeply concerned that Iceland has resumed whaling and proposes to slaughter 500 sei, fin and minke whales over the next two years; deplores Iceland's killing of minke whales in 2003; notes the growing importance of whale watching and eco-tourism to the future of both the Scottish and Icelandic tourist industry, and calls on the Scottish Executive to highlight these concerns to the Her Majesty's Government and add its opposition to commercial whaling to that of the Her Majesty's Government and the wider international community. Supported by: Trish Godman, Christine Grahame, Mr Richard Baker, Bristow Muldoon, Sarah Boyack, Bill Butler, Michael Matheson, Christine May, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Marlyn Glen, Nora Radcliffe, Shiona Baird, Eleanor Scott, Maureen Macmillan, Phil Gallie, Elaine Smith, Chris Ballance, Mr Jamie Stone, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Cathie Craigie, Dr Jean Turner, Scott Barrie, Mike Watson, Mark Ballard, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan, Patrick Harvie, Mr Mark Ruskell, Jackie Baillie, Mike Pringle, Marilyn Livingstone, Robin Harper*, Rhona Brankin*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Frances Curran*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Dennis Canavan*
S2M-290 Support for the International Whaling Commission Moratorium on Commercial Whaling (lodged on 2 September 2003) Pauline McNeill*
